conclusion: Analyze the scenario of a head-on collision between two balls in a magnetic field using conservation principles.
Depicts a horizontal platform with ball P moving towards ball Q on the right, with a magnetic field B directed outward.
Ball P has mass M = 4m and no charge, moving with velocity v0 = mg/qB. Ball Q has mass m and charge -q.
Magnetic field B exerts a force on Q, causing it to move with velocity vQ = qB/m.
Total momentum before collision equals total momentum after collision; kinetic energy is conserved.
Sum of kinetic energies of P and Q before collision equals sum after collision.
Solving momentum and energy equations gives velocities after collision: vP = mg/qB and vQ = qB/m.
Height h of the platform does not affect the collision outcome.
Final velocities of balls after collision are vP = mg/qB and vQ = qB/m.
